      • copy

        public BayesianFactor copy()
        Factors are only mutable in their data. The domain should not change in time. We can therefore use the original domain.
        Specified by:
        copy in interface GenericFactor

      • p

        public double p​(String def)
        Get the value of a single parameter in the bayesian factor identified by the instantiation provided as a string. Ex: p("0=1 | 1=3, 2=4")
        Parameters:
        def - the instantiation string
        Returns:
        the parameter's values

      • marginalize

        public BayesianFactor marginalize​(int variable)

        Marginalize a variable out of the factor. This corresponds to sum all parameters that differ only in the state of the marginalized variable.

        If this factor represent a Conditional Probability Table you should only marginalize variables on the right side of the conditioning bar. If so, there is no need for further normalization.

        Specified by:
        marginalize in interface Factor<BayesianFactor>
        Specified by:
        marginalize in interface Operable<BayesianFactor>
        Parameters:
        variable - the variable to be summed out of the CPT
        Returns:
        the new CPT with the variable marginalized out.

      • combineIterator

        public BayesianFactor combineIterator​(BayesianFactor cpt)
        Combine the provided factor with this one.

      • combine

        public BayesianFactor combine​(BayesianFactor factor)
        The specialized method that avoids the cast of the input variable.

        This implementation uses long values for strides, sizes and indices, allowing for combined operations. Increasing the index is, for instance, one single add instead of two. The values will contain in the Lower 32bit this factor's values and in the upper 32 the parameter's ones. Given that most architectures are 64 bit, this should give a tiny performance improvement.

        Specified by:
        combine in interface Factor<BayesianFactor>
        Specified by:
        combine in interface Operable<BayesianFactor>
        Parameters:
        factor -
        Returns:

      • addition

        public BayesianFactor addition​(BayesianFactor factor)
        The specialized method that avoids the cast of the input variable.

        This implementation uses long values for strides, sizes and indices, allowing for combined operations. Increasing the index is, for instance, one single add instead of two. The values will contain in the Lower 32bit this factor's values and in the upper 32 the parameter's ones. Given that most architectures are 64 bit, this should give a tiny performance improvement.

        Parameters:
        factor -
        Returns:

      • divide

        public BayesianFactor divide​(BayesianFactor factor)
        divide this factor by the provided one. This assumes that the domain of the given factor is a subset of this one's.

      • deterministic

        public static BayesianFactor deterministic​(Strides left,
                                           Strides right,
                                           int... assignments)
        Static method that builds a deterministic factor (values can only be ones or zeros). Thus, children variables are determined by the values of the parents
        Parameters:
        left - Strides - children variables.
        right - Strides - parent variables
        assignments - assignments of each combination of the parent
        Returns:

      • deterministic

        public static BayesianFactor deterministic​(Strides left,
                                           int assignment)
        Static method that builds a deterministic factor (values can only be ones or zeros) without parent variables.
        Parameters:
        left - Strides - children variables.
        assignment - int - single value to assign
        Returns:
